body:
I'm checking it so that we don't perform all the unnecessary calculations on scopes that don't contain bits from the default scope. Note that:

    some_relation = unscoped.red.published.where(...)
    some_relation.__id__ == some_relation.without_default.__id__

The separate whithout_default "branch" is maintained only when necessary.

I'm not sure whether it should be user facing. It's definitely a hack. I think building a relation from unscoped is preferred, but given current API we sometimes need to "add" it to relations we receive as arguments retroactively. It's not there to be a feature on it's own. We might find a better way to implement default and named scopes in the future and I wouldn't weep telling this method bye bye.
